cluster_classes.class_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems, including local, national, and global economies that interact with sports and other activities.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: local economies, the global economy, and the economy as systems of production and consumption affected by sports

members.entity_description: Regional economic systems around host locations that are stimulated by major sporting events.
The worldwide economic system in which the sports industry now plays a major role.
The system of production and consumption to which sports contribute.

cluster_classes.class_description: The organized sports industry and its associated markets for sports-related goods and services.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the sports industry as a major player with billions spent on sports-related products and services

members.entity_description: The aggregate of businesses and activities related to sports, now a major global economic sector.
Goods and services associated with sports on which billions of dollars are spent annually.

args.new_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems (local, national, and global) that interact with and are influenced by sports.
args.justification: Refines the label and type hint to emphasize that this class covers broad economic systems (local, national, global) as contexts for sports, and assigns a shared Class_Group that captures its close relation to the sports economy domain.

args.new_description: The organized sports industry and associated markets for sports-related goods and services as a distinct economic sector.
args.justification: Clarifies that this class covers the sports industry as a specific economic sector (firms and markets for sports-related goods and services), and aligns it under the same Sports and Economics Class_Group as the broader economic systems class while keeping the concepts distinct.

executed_decisions.new_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems (local, national, and global) that interact with and are influenced by sports.
executed_decisions.justification: Refines the label and type hint to emphasize that this class covers broad economic systems (local, national, global) as contexts for sports, and assigns a shared Class_Group that captures its close relation to the sports economy domain.

executed_decisions.new_description: The organized sports industry and associated markets for sports-related goods and services as a distinct economic sector.
executed_decisions.justification: Clarifies that this class covers the sports industry as a specific economic sector (firms and markets for sports-related goods and services), and aligns it under the same Sports and Economics Class_Group as the broader economic systems class while keeping the concepts distinct.
